elements.description:
Login to Facebook and request a set of publish permissions.
The user is prompted to authorize the application using the login dialog of the specific platform. Even if the user is already logged in to Facebook this function can still be used to request additional publish permissions.
A comprehensive list of permissions can be found in the [Facebook permissions](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login/permissions) documentation, as well as in their [guide to best practices for login management](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/facebook-login/best-practices).
elements.name: login_with_permissions

parameters.doc: table with the requested publish permission strings.
parameters.name: permissions

parameters.doc:
The audience that should be able to see the publications. Can be any of
- `facebook.AUDIENCE_NONE`
- `facebook.AUDIENCE_ONLYME`
- `facebook.AUDIENCE_FRIENDS`
- `facebook.AUDIENCE_EVERYONE`
parameters.name: audience

parameters.doc: Callback function that is executed when the permission request dialog is closed.
parameters.name: callback

elements.description: Logout from Facebook
elements.name: logout

elements.description:
Get the current Facebook access token.
This function returns the currently stored access token after a previous successful login. If it returns nil no access token exists and you need to perform a login to get the wanted permissions.
elements.name: access_token

returnvalues.doc: the access token or nil if the user is not logged in
returnvalues.name: string

elements.description:
Get the currently granted permissions.
This function returns a table with all the currently granted permission strings.
elements.name: permissions

elements.description:
Post an event to Facebook Analytics
This function will post an event to Facebook Analytics where it can be used in the Facebook Insights system.
elements.name: post_event

parameters.doc:
An event can either be one of the predefined constants below or a text string which can be used to define a custom event that is registered with Facebook Analytics.
- `facebook.EVENT_ACHIEVED_LEVEL` - `facebook.EVENT_ADDED_PAYMENT_INFO` - `facebook.EVENT_ADDED_TO_CART` - `facebook.EVENT_ADDED_TO_WISHLIST` - `facebook.EVENT_COMPLETED_REGISTRATION` - `facebook.EVENT_COMPLETED_TUTORIAL` - `facebook.EVENT_INITIATED_CHECKOUT` - `facebook.EVENT_PURCHASED` - `facebook.EVENT_RATED` - `facebook.EVENT_SEARCHED` - `facebook.EVENT_SPENT_CREDITS` - `facebook.EVENT_TIME_BETWEEN_SESSIONS` - `facebook.EVENT_UNLOCKED_ACHIEVEMENT` - `facebook.EVENT_VIEWED_CONTENT`
parameters.name: event

parameters.doc: A numeric value for the event. This should represent the value of the event, such as the level achieved, price for an item or number of orcs killed.
parameters.name: value

parameters.doc:
Optional table with parameters and their values. A key in the table can either be one of the predefined constants below or a text which can be used to define a custom parameter.
- `facebook.PARAM_CONTENT_ID` - `facebook.PARAM_CONTENT_TYPE` - `facebook.PARAM_CURRENCY` - `facebook.PARAM_DESCRIPTION` - `facebook.PARAM_LEVEL` - `facebook.PARAM_MAX_RATING_VALUE` - `facebook.PARAM_NUM_ITEMS` - `facebook.PARAM_PAYMENT_INFO_AVAILABLE` - `facebook.PARAM_REGISTRATION_METHOD` - `facebook.PARAM_SEARCH_STRING` - `facebook.PARAM_SOURCE_APPLICATION` - `facebook.PARAM_SUCCESS`
parameters.name: params

elements.description:
Enable event usage with Facebook Analytics This function will enable event usage for Facebook Analytics which means that Facebook will be able to use event data for ad-tracking.
[icon:attention] Event usage cannot be controlled and is always enabled for the Facebook Canvas platform, therefore this function has no effect on Facebook Canvas.
elements.name: enable_event_usage

elements.description:
Disable event usage with Facebook Analytics This function will disable event usage for Facebook Analytics which means that Facebook won't be able to use event data for ad-tracking. Events will still be sent to Facebook for insights.
[icon:attention] Event usage cannot be controlled and is always enabled for the Facebook Canvas platform, therefore this function has no effect on Facebook Canvas.
elements.name: disable_event_usage

elements.description:
Show facebook web dialog
Display a Facebook web dialog of the type specified in the `dialog` parameter.

The `param` table should be set up according to the requirements of each dialog type. Note that some parameters are mandatory. Below is the list of available dialogs and where to find Facebook's developer documentation on parameters and response data.

`"apprequests"`
Shows a Game Request dialog. Game Requests allows players to invite their friends to play a game. Available parameters
- [type:string] `title`
- [type:string] `message`
- [type:number] `action_type`
- [type:number] `filters`
- [type:string] `data`
- [type:string] `object_id`
- [type:table] `suggestions`
- [type:table] `recipients`
- [type:string] `to`


On success, the "result" table parameter passed to the callback function will include the following fields
- [type:string] `request_id`
- [type:table] `to`

[Details for each parameter](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/games/services/gamerequests/v2.6#dialogparameters)

`"feed"`
The Feed Dialog allows people to publish individual stories to their timeline.

- [type:string] `caption`
- [type:string] `description`
- [type:string] `picture`
- [type:string] `link`
- [type:table] `people_ids`
- [type:string] `place_id`
- [type:string] `ref`


On success, the "result" table parameter passed to the callback function will include the following fields
- [type:string] `post_id`

[Details for each parameter](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/sharing/reference/feed-dialog/v2.6#params)

`"appinvite"`
The App Invite dialog is available only on iOS and Android. Note that the `url` parameter corresponds to the appLinkURL (iOS) and setAppLinkUrl (Android) properties.
- [type:string] `url`
- [type:string] `preview_image`
[Details for each parameter](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/ios/current/class/FBSDKAppInviteContent)
elements.name: show_dialog

parameters.doc: Callback function that is called when the dialog is closed.
parameters.name: callback

elements.description: Get the version of the Facebook SDK used by the extension.
elements.name: get_version

elements.description:
Allows receiving deferred deep link URL and parameters.
[More info about Referred Deep Links](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/app-ads/deep-linking/)
elements.name: deferred_deep_link

parameters.doc: Callback function that is called when information is ready.
parameters.name: callback

elements.description: The Facebook login session is open
elements.name: STATE_OPEN

elements.description: The Facebook login session has closed because login failed
elements.name: STATE_CLOSED_LOGIN_FAILED

elements.description: Game request action type "none" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_ACTIONTYPE_NONE

elements.description: Game request action type "send" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_ACTIONTYPE_SEND

elements.description: Game request action type "askfor" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_ACTIONTYPE_ASKFOR

elements.description: Game request action type "turn" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_ACTIONTYPE_TURN

elements.description: Game request filter type "none" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_FILTER_NONE

elements.description: Game request filter type "app_users" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_FILTER_APPUSERS

elements.description: Game request filter type "app_non_users" for "apprequests" dialog
elements.name: GAMEREQUEST_FILTER_APPNONUSERS

elements.description: Log this event when the user has achieved a level
elements.name: EVENT_ACHIEVED_LEVEL

elements.description: Log this event when the user has entered their payment info
elements.name: EVENT_ADDED_PAYMENT_INFO

elements.description: Log this event when the user has added an item to their cart The value_to_sum passed to facebook.post_event should be the item's price.
elements.name: EVENT_ADDED_TO_CART

elements.description: Log this event when the user has added an item to their wish list The value_to_sum passed to facebook.post_event should be the item's price.
elements.name: EVENT_ADDED_TO_WISHLIST

elements.description: Log this event when a user has completed registration with the app
elements.name: EVENT_COMPLETED_REGISTRATION

elements.description: Log this event when the user has completed a tutorial in the app
elements.name: EVENT_COMPLETED_TUTORIAL

elements.description: Log this event when the user has entered the checkout process The value_to_sum passed to facebook.post_event should be the total price in the cart.
elements.name: EVENT_INITIATED_CHECKOUT

elements.description: Log this event when the user has completed a purchase. The value_to_sum passed to facebook.post_event should be the numeric rating.
elements.name: EVENT_PURCHASED

elements.description: Log this event when the user has rated an item in the app
elements.name: EVENT_RATED

elements.description: Log this event when a user has performed a search within the app
elements.name: EVENT_SEARCHED

elements.description: Log this event when the user has spent app credits The value_to_sum passed to facebook.post_event should be the number of credits spent.
elements.name: EVENT_SPENT_CREDITS

elements.description: Log this event when measuring the time between user sessions
elements.name: EVENT_TIME_BETWEEN_SESSIONS

elements.description: Log this event when the user has unlocked an achievement in the app
elements.name: EVENT_UNLOCKED_ACHIEVEMENT

elements.description: Log this event when a user has viewed a form of content in the app
elements.name: EVENT_VIEWED_CONTENT

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify an ID for the content being logged about
The parameter key could be an EAN, article identifier, etc., depending on the nature of the app.
elements.name: PARAM_CONTENT_ID

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify a generic content type/family for the logged event
The key is an arbitrary type/family (e.g. "music", "photo", "video") depending on the nature of the app.
elements.name: PARAM_CONTENT_TYPE

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify currency used with logged event
Use a currency value key, e.g. "USD", "EUR", "GBP" etc. See See ISO-4217 for specific values.
elements.name: PARAM_CURRENCY

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify a description appropriate to the event being logged
Use this for app specific event description, for instance the name of the achievement unlocked in the facebook.EVENT_UNLOCKED_ACHIEVEMENT event.
elements.name: PARAM_DESCRIPTION

elements.description: Parameter key used to specify the level achieved
elements.name: PARAM_LEVEL

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify the maximum rating available
Set to specify the max rating available for the facebook.EVENT_RATED event. E.g., "5" or "10".
elements.name: PARAM_MAX_RATING_VALUE

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify how many items are being processed
Set to specify the number of items being processed for an facebook.EVENT_INITIATED_CHECKOUT or facebook.EVENT_PURCHASED event.
elements.name: PARAM_NUM_ITEMS

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify whether payment info is available
Set to specify if payment info is available for the facebook.EVENT_INITIATED_CHECKOUT event.
elements.name: PARAM_PAYMENT_INFO_AVAILABLE

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify method user has used to register for the app
Set to specify what registation method a user used for the app, e.g. "Facebook", "email", "Twitter", etc.
elements.name: PARAM_REGISTRATION_METHOD

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify user search string
Set this to the the string that the user provided for a search operation.
elements.name: PARAM_SEARCH_STRING

elements.description: Parameter key used to specify source application package
elements.name: PARAM_SOURCE_APPLICATION

elements.description:
Parameter key used to specify activity success
Set this key to indicate whether the activity being logged about was successful or not.
elements.name: PARAM_SUCCESS

elements.description: Publish permission to reach no audience
elements.name: AUDIENCE_NONE

elements.description: Publish permission to reach only me (private to current user)
elements.name: AUDIENCE_ONLYME

elements.description: Publish permission to reach user friends
elements.name: AUDIENCE_FRIENDS

elements.description: Publish permission to reach everyone
elements.name: AUDIENCE_EVERYONE

info.description: Functions and constants for interacting with Facebook APIs
info.name: facebook
